Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: LANYC1110
Reviews.Content: It's not fancy, but it's a great basic hotel. It's the second time that I stayed in this spot. It's in a great location, it's very clean, and it's affordable. The rooms aren't huge, they are clean, they have free wifi, a secure lobby, and the staff is very nice and accomodating. A great place!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Professional little hotel”
Reviews.Author: CharityClarity
Reviews.Content: We are at Hotel Panda now. We love it. It's safe, clean and the location is amazing. Everything is walking distance. We are with our 11 and 13 year old kids. We're from NYC and so we're used to walking. Still, we've barely used any transportation, except when it was pouring rain. We've walked from the hotel to the Colosseum, Forum, Pantheon, Vatican, Trevy Fountain, and other major sites. The hotel is quiet, as it's located in a pedestrian only area. Still, I'd read tripadvisor and asked for a room on the courtyard side just in case. We have a quad. It's quite cute, cream walls, about 14 foot ceiling with ancient wooden beams. My kids are in a bunk bed. The bath is big enough and has a sculpture in it! No bath, just shower but the water pressure and temp are ok. Wifi is great. Towels are large if not fluffy. My ny warning is that my husband came a day early and I'd reserved a single on the courtyard. He said that the little room looked out n something more like an air shaft than a courtyard. Our present quad has a small balcony (which we can't go out on) and plants, a view of the sky and the sound of birds. It's very restful. I'd definitely come back here and would recommend it to friends. They recommended a great little pizzeria nearby, non touristy in a touristy area. It's called Pizzaria Al Leoncino and it was a perfect genuine Italian place for locals.

Reviews.Title: “basic, but a good bargain”
Reviews.Author: kaf8e
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights in March 2012. It's in a great location a couple of blocks from the Spanish Steps and quite a bit cheaper than most hotels in the area, and I had stayed here happily many years ago in my backpacking days. I was a bit worried about whether it would prove to be too spartan for my tastes these days, but it was fine, though basic. The people at the front desk were friendly (and emailed us right away when we left to tell us we had left our camera in the room) and the room was clean and not too small for comfort. We were in room no. 20, which was right by the reception and looked out over the street, but we were not disturbed by noise during our stay in the least. I might opt for something nicer next time, but I don't regret staying there and I'm glad of the money we saved by doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, and our room was large enough.”
Reviews.Author: redshale
Reviews.Content: We (a couple) stayed three nights in March, 2012. We had room 29, which has an en suite bathroom with shower (not all do). The room was big enough for us-it had a single bed (made a great suitcase stand) in addition to the double, and a closet for hanging coats. My guess is that all rooms are not that large, based on other postings. There is no lift for the hotel. The reception area is on the 2nd floor (3rd to Americans), and the rooms are on the 2nd and 1st floors. It is only 2-3 blocks from Spanish Steps, and the price in mid-March was 108 Euro/night. Breakfast is not included, but there is a nearby cafe that opens at 7:00.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: HNOR
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2011 for 3 nights. There was myself, my husband and my little girl who had just turned 1. The location of this hotel was fantastic, great for restaurants and all the sights. Also very convenient to nip back which was very hand with a baby. Cannot say I noticed much noise, it certanly didn't keep us awake. The room was an ok fair size but very very clean and the staff were fantastic, couldn't do enough for us. They provided a cot bed for my baby which again was spotless, set it all up and provided all the bedding. Much better service than I would normally get in the uk. Cannot rate it high enough if you want a cheap, friendly hotel in the centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: cr135liv
Reviews.Content: The hotel Panda is a basic hotel but in a great location. I think our room was a triple as it had a small cotbed also in it, so it was not quite as small as I think it could have been if we had a normal double, and it had an en-suite and tiny balcony at the back looking on to other buildings. It also had a nice high ceiling with original beams and some slightly odd statues on a ledge above the bed but it made it a little quirky. We were only there for a day and a half so it was fine as a base for sleeping and spent our time out enjoying Rome. We went during high season so I was little worried about whether the air-conditioning would cope but it was fine (though a little noisy). The only negative thing was that in the bathroom there was a slight smell of sewage which I think probably is the drains and beyond the control of the hotel as it was 30C when we were there but it meant we had to remember to keep the door shut. Staff at the hotel were very nice and helpful and the room was clean, we arrived quite early, about 10:30am and were able to check-in early which was great. So it is a great base for sightseeing. For the price (still seems a lot but it is not for Rome) the location is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: cruisingcousin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights with our son & family in November. Excellent location. Wonderful, helpful staff. Will definitely book again, next time in Rome. well priced. only drawback is there are some stairs but we managed just fine. Well priced. Loved the cappucino & croissant at nearby cafe in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good accommodations, great location”
Reviews.Author: chiliTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Panda for four nights last May. We found the location to be fantastic and a great home base for exploring Rome. We walked everywhere and took the subway as well. The hotel is small with narrow hallways, and the rooms are clean and basic. We had a double room with ensuite bath and faced into the courtyard, which was very pleasant. We did not have any trouble with noise and found the bed to be comfortable. Our room was tiled with basic decor, but very pleasant. No TVs and the wifi was a little bit spotty but was free. For the price, you cannot beat this place!! It is not a luxury hotel but if you are looking for a clean, well kept place to stay at the Spanish Steps this is it. The staff was very helpful and arranged to have laundry done for us, which was very affordable, but did take some time as it has to be line dried. They told us this upfront so we had it done at the beginning of our stay and it was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, but great location and value”
Reviews.Author: EBCincy
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Panda in Rome based on reference from the owners of our hotel in Florence. It was a great location--close to Spanish Steps and Via del Corso--so perfect. Really no character, but simple, basic, clean lodgings--which is what we were looking for. If you want elegant--this isn't your place. But if you want value and convenience, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: paulabravo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel last September. It's very well located and safe, my room was very spacious and clean, and they have a very nice staff. The only thing you have to take into consideration is that you have to carry your luggage up the stairs. Their elevator is useless because it starts from the 1st level (not the ground floor) and stops between the levels where the rooms are. After you have entered the front door of the "Pensione" and climbed the stairs to the 1st level, you still have to ring another bell to meet the recepcionist and make your check in. Until then you'll see nobody… But after this first difficulty, you'll feel like at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Location and Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: alexa v
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October when visiting a friend who was studying abroad. As a single female who was alone most of the day when my friend was in class, I needed a place with a central location that felt safe. I stayed in a single room with a shared bathroom, which I was nervous about, but I found it fine for the three nights I was there. The room is small but it was fine for what I needed, which was simply a place to sleep and store my luggage. I was pleasantly surprised by how clean the rooms were kept, as they were serviced every day. The best part of the hotel though was its incredible location, a mere 3 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and 7 minutes from the Piazza del Popolo; also close is great shopping and the Ara Pacis Museum. I walked basically everywhere in Rome and except for the Forum, it basically took me no more than 20 minutes from this location. Lastly I want to say that the staff are just great, they were extremely helpful and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “This is a 4+ - excellent base, very friendly, quiet”
Reviews.Author: AlexandraHammond
Reviews.Content: Hotel Panda was our base for our 3 night stay in Rome, and it was an excellent location for sightseeing. The rooms are basic, but perfectly adequate, and our room faced the inner courtyard, so we had quiet nights despite being very central. The staff are friendly, and they provide internet and travel info (city maps, etc) at reception. It's a bit like an upscale hostle, but for the price you pay, it's very good value. I'd recommend it to a friend, though it does lack a "wow" factor.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: Sophie0276
Reviews.Content: We got the room right next to reception, which was indeed VERY small and noisy. To be fair, it was advertised as small, but it was also very noisy, as of about 8am every morning. It's true that in Rome you only use a room to sleep so in that sense we didn't mind that the room was small. The room and bathroom were clean, althought the shower had very very little pressure and went from scalding to cold throughout the time of the shower. We caught a glance of other rooms which seemed bigger and further away from reception. All in all, if you know beforehand what you're getting the place is OK. But we wouldn't go back, we'd find a place where we could get a good night's rest and a good shower. About half the staff are very friendly and the other half quite rude.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: AngelaBax
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel, very clean, large rooms and in the best location in Rome - a short walk from the Spanish Steps. The price is outstanding considering it is in the middle of all the designer shopping. The room we had overlooked Via della Croce and although the noise from the restaurants below was fairly loud it added to the atmosphere of being in Rome. Only draw back is that there is no lift to the reception on the second floor - so if your case is heavy take a deep breath!

Reviews.Title: “Not for large people”
Reviews.Author: Italipino
Reviews.Content: This pensione is located a block away from the Spanish Steps and when you walk onto the street you'd think you'd died and gone to heaven, it's so beautiful. We paid 100 euros which is a steal but in return you get a small "cell" as my husband put it and a shower that trickles rather than flows. Front desk staff fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “great value near the Spanish Steps...”
Reviews.Author: denaliboy
Reviews.Content: this is a no frills hotel with clean rooms and very friendly staff. my wife and i were very pleased with the location...minutes from the spanish steps and the spagna metro station. we opted to stay away from the craziness near the colosseum/forum/termini station. if you want romantic strolls through the roman streets, consider this hotel! it is all about its great location!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Phileas F
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in Rome, just down the street from the Spanish steps and Via del Corso. The street that it is located on, Via Croce, is itself a sampling of all that makes Rome and Italy special. A great restaurant is just across the street (Enoteca Antica, rated by Rick Steves) and a cafe with pastries and coffee right next door. As for the hotel itself, I stayed on the third floor. It was a pain to bring the luggage all the way up the steps and I had to carry my travel companion's luggage. But the rooms were very clean as were the bathrooms. Bathrooms are modern but shared with other people on the floor. The only downside to this hotel is that the rooms are very small. Just large enough for a double bed, a sink, bedside table, small shelf, and wardrobe closet. No extra floor space and no chairs. But if you are not spending much time in the room, than it is just the right fit and the location more than makes up for the small size. The AC unit is up high near the ceiling and is remote controlled but did not seem to generate a lot of cold air, so if you are traveling when its hot, just beware. The girl at the front desk gives a good recommendation for a pizzeria. All in all, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: JMTravelor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just a few blocks away from the Spanish Steps. Although some may prefer to stay closer to the Colosseum/Ancient Rome area, my husband and I really enjoyed experiencing the Spagna and "Old Rome" areas. I am giving this place 4 stars based on the value. It is not a luxury hotel by any means but for 98 euros a night we got a decent sized room with air conditioning and our own bathroom. The hotel was clean and service was good - new clean towels each day. I think some rooms are smaller than the one we had ... not sure our experience would have been the same with a smaller room. Make sure you know what you're getting. When we made our reservations via email, they specifically stated we'd be getting a "small room", so I expected the worst but we actually had adequate space.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, small bathroom and small bed”
Reviews.Author: Swanchan
Reviews.Content: I am a budget traveller and this was worst place I'd ever been. The end of our bed might be 3 feets to the door and side was another 3 feets to the washroom. Imagine after you bring your luggage into your room; your could only stay on your bed. The private bathroom was so small, whenever you get in and out of the shower, you help clean the toilet. The only reason I picked this place was becasue it was a few minutes from Spanish Steps and metro. Lucky I stay there only 1 night before our cruise and I will not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Big things come in small packages!”
Reviews.Author: twiny02
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Panda with another couple the first 3 nights of our Italian holiday. The hotel is conveniently located on a pedestrian road, minutes from the Spanish Steps and Metro station one way, and fabulous shopping the other. The rooms were VERY tiny, but completely expected. They were clean which is really the only thing we cared about. There is a lift if needed for luggage. They offered free internet which was very convenient. But the best part about this hotel was the extremely helpful front desk!! Our luggage was "lost" and the hotel called the airport for us a couple of times a day to check on its status. They would give us a report at the end of the day. We in no way expected them to do this for us but we very greatly appreciated their help. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others!! One thing I would say is to avoid the sit down restaurants on that road as the food is not the greatest. There is one walk up/take-away place that was decent for a quick bite, but go to Gusto or somewhere that the people dont try to pull you in from off the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, lovely staff, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: Aisling M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently, based on recommendations from family and friends who'd stayed here before. The location was fantastic, just a 5 minute walk from the Spanish Steps and metro. The staff were lovely and very helpful. Our room was much bigger than I'd expected, very clean and all you need for a sightseeing holiday on a budget. We had air conditioning, free WiFi and use of a laptop in the reception area. We will definitely be staying here again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Ryan8033130
Reviews.Content: Hotel panda is the best bang for your buck If your staying in Rome. We stayed in a double room with bathroom and found it quite spacious despite what some other reviews said. The location is perfect. 5 mins from the Spanish steps 5 mins from via de corso. The staff was helpful as well. We arrived into Rome at 6 in the morning and got to the hotel by 8. We expected our room to not be ready till 12 but the front desk ensured us that he would have it ready by 9 and kindly offered to let us have a shower and that he would watch our bags.the only cons are that the elevator can barely fit one person so expect to climb some stairs. Also it's more bed and breakfast without breakfast. You can purchase breakfast vouchers for a cafe about 40 yards from the hotel but we found it better to go outside of the area to eat. But besides that the hotel panda is the best place to stay if you plan to visit Rome as I intend to do everytime I come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: TorontoJos
Reviews.Content: My four star rating is primarily due to the location and convenience provided by Hotel Panda. I don't think you will find a better location for the budget price. We literally walked around the corner to the Spanish Steps. Most of the major attractions are within walking distance- the Colisseum, the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain. We arrived from the airport in a van, an arrangement made ahead of time through the Hotel Panda. You should be aware that there is not an elevator in this hotel- one must walk up to the second floor to find the hotel reception desk. Nothing fancy! Our room had a double bed, an armoire, a private bath with roomy shower and a cot/bed off to one side of the room which was handy when our friends dropped by for a glass of wine. The other couple had a small room they were not happy with but they had no trouble exchanging for a larger one. This is a hotel room you will sleep in only- no point in staying in your room when you're in Rome! Across the street from the hotel is a cafe where we enjoyed cappuccino every morning. We sat outside at an umbrella table. The street is an old fashioned cobblestone lane and there is little vehicle traffic, mostly delivery trucks to the local businesses. Lots of bustle and good for people watching. We had several good meals in the vicinity. If you walk around during the day, read the menus in restaurant windows so you can check out prices. An added bonus for us was the nearby market where we bought fresh fruit, bread and cheese. I bought a huge piece of parmasan cheese which was shrink wrapped for me to stow away in my luggage. It was 8 euros, it was delicious and we enjoyed it for several months.

Reviews.Title: “It used to be better, but the staff remains fantastic and the location is unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: worldcitizen318
Reviews.Content: I stayed here several times in 2006 and always remembered it being super clean. This time around, I was a little disappointed in the lack of cleanliness (namely in our bathroom). However, the staff remains as warm and helpful as ever and the location is simply unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings: good location with nice rooms, but noisy and small”
Reviews.Author: EazyK
Reviews.Content: The location of this little hotel is really good. It's only a minute away from Piazza di Spagna, the square with the Spanish Steps. Also, it is reasonable priced and the clean hotel rooms are nicely decorated. Ofcourse, you cannot expect to get an enormous hotel room when staying right in the centre of Rome, so the rooms of Hotel Panda are really small. The two-person bed is only recommended when you want to sleep really close to each other, as it is a small Italian-sized bed. Even worse: the walls of the rooms are extremely thin, so every movement of other hotel guests can be heard loud and clear. In addition, the staff seems a little demotivated and is not helpful. The administration of the hotel seems to be a mess, a lot of hand-written papers. Airconditioning is not included in the price, you have to pay in the hotel to get the remote control for it. This hotel is a fine choice when location and value are important to you. But in high season when the hotel is fully booked, I would recommend to find a less noisy hotel with a little more comfort.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value right by the spanish steps”
Reviews.Author: ultimatebarbiegirl99
Reviews.Content: Rome is a busy busy city and if you want somewhere central for low cost - somewhere you can head back to for an hours break then this is the place It's near enough to everything that you can walk and yes the bathroom was a little small but for me and my mum it was great - if i had taken my 6ft 4 husband then he would have complained to me about the size fo the shower but no one else- not for that price!! 100% fantastic value for a mega wknd in Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in a fab location!”
Reviews.Author: CaberraKerry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in a very quiet room with a good air conditioner! Although the location is in a busy street, the room was quiet and perfect to relax in after a hot day in Rome. The bathroom is cost but fully functional and the shower hot when needed. Room was clean and large enough which was good. Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an authentic stay in a great location for a good price. Better than some large chain hotel which you could stay in anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Between a rock and Versace shops ??????”
Reviews.Author: ozi-volleygal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband in a double room facing onto the street. The window shutters gave this room a great air of charm. The street below starts the day as a quiet alley, at night it becomes a thoroughfare of restaurants, mopeds , accordian playing buskers and locals wandering through. However it was still easy to get a good nights sleep. The room itself was basic, very small shower cubicle, but that is to be expected of Europe. Its location to shops was amazing. At one end of our street were the Spanish Steps , and the super high end shops at the other was the via De Corsco ?Cant quite remember because my eyes glazed over when I saw the shops.There is everything along this stretch and on Sundays its closed off for pedestrians. We were able to walk to the Collosseum, the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and around with ease. The prices were great and downstairs each morning you have a choice of reataurants to chose from. Staff were okay, nopthing to friendly, but hey -its Italy, thats just how it is.

Reviews.Title: “Location is worth tiny room”
Reviews.Author: MelCarv
Reviews.Content: The location of Hotel Panda is very worth the money. It's very economical but at first you're thinking 80 euros for this? Yes! Close to everything, we walked practically everywhere. Plus, the rooms are clean. We didn't spring the extra for an ensuite bathroom but we never waited for the bathroom once and at least there is a sink in the room. Would recommend walking a bit further away to eat so you don't pay so much. If you're up for the walk checkout the Trastevere area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, simple & clean, good value in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Brazucanomundo
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in Rome. Close to Spanish Steps, clean, no frills, great staff, 117 euros with bathroom ensuite. All that you want.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Location”
Reviews.Author: kansasforever
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 2 nights in April 2011. The Hotel Panda is certainly not posh, but it does the trick: clean rooms, helpful staff, and smack in the centre of one of Rome's best neighborhoods... This place is really a hidden gem for the budget traveler. Rome is already so expensive, save your money for food and museums. The room was tiny, but spotless and perfectly functional.... and I loved the coffee and juice at the cafe downstairs, all included in the price. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: CGDLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Panda for 3 nights in April. This is less of a hotel (I don't mean that badly) and more likea bed and breakfast .... without the breakfast. That said, you do have the option of buying a 5 euro voucher to have breakfast at the nearby cafe. We skipped this and went to the cafe for a very good coffee and cornetti (like a croissant) for 2 euros each (i thinkd it's called Angelos - turn right and its a few doors up on the corner - great coffee to wake you up in the mornings) Back to the hotel - Pros were: Location, comfortable beds, relatively peaceful hotel given how central it was and generally very clean. The main disadvantage is the size of the rooms - we had a double but found it very small - in particular the shower room (no baths here) was tiny - although clean and the water was always a good temperature. I thought it quite pricey at 108 euros but maybe that's what you have to pay to stay centrally in Rome.A couple of tips: The cab transfer from the airport is quite pricey (45-50 euros) so if you can get the train, it's a much cheaper option. We arrived very late so had little option - if you do take a taxi, opt for one oif the white ones in the queue outside - we were approached by 3 taxi touts all quoting in the region of 65 to 70 euros! A tip for food - a nearby restaurant a few doors away with purple table cloths (sorry can't recall name) was very good and reasonably priced. A few doors to the left, there is a restaurant called Toto - eat there at your peril (read my reiview under Toto restaurant, Rome) The area is generally very pricey to eat and the food generally 'tourist' standard - if you can move away a bit to eat- to even the Pantheon- you'll get a better deal for your euros. ...

Reviews.Title: “4 great nights in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mammaisontheinternet
Reviews.Content: Superlative location for the price in pricey Rome. Our room was around 100 Euro/night since we paid with cash. Breakfast isn't included which is a good think since there are an infinitude of cafes in the area where you can get your coffee and sweet rolls. The room was very comfortable, reasonably large and quite stylish. The shower was small although this didn't bother us at all. The elevator in the building is a bit unusual so be prepared to carry your bags up a flight or two of marble stairs. This wasn't a big deal for us but we say older travelers that weren't thrilled. We'd stay here again in a heartbeat based on the location, the price and the quality of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Best Accomodation in Rome, considering the price paid!!!”
Reviews.Author: NicoletteSpiteri
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for our holiday for New Year's Eve because it was one of the cheapest, but I was so satisfied that even if I find cheaper accomdation I would still stay at this hotel again. Thee location is perfect, very close to the Spanish steps and walking distance from the main attractions in Rome. We never used public transport during our stay there. The service is great, the staff is very friendly and helpful. They gave us maps and advice. The rooms were very clean, cleaned everyday. Although the rooms are not very big they are very comfortable. Reception is open 24hrs a day and you are always welcomed with a smile whatever the time you decide to go back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Near the Spanish Steps and a subway stop = great location!”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysARunnerGirl
Reviews.Content: We knew Rome would be an expensive place to stay so we were looking for affordable, clean and a decent location since we were 2 traveling women and wanted to feel comfortable coming home at night. This place did not disappoint! From the Spanish Steps it's about a ~ 5 minute walk or so. It's on the left coming from the Spanish steps right past a corner with a coffee shop on the left and a wine bar on the right. Note the picture of the front door in the Trip Advisor pics - this really helped us! Friendly staff and the front desk was manned every time we came in and out of the hotel. The room we had was a double with our own bathroom. It's small, smaller than you'd expect, but you're not spending time in your room in Rome so it worked for us! A small closet with 2 shelves, a small table, a window that opened to an alley and a tight bathroom but hot showers and clean! If you are looking for a place to sleep, just sleep, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “We got what we asked for - a quiet, clean room with ensuite.”
Reviews.Author: Cara777
Reviews.Content: Hotel Panda had a great location & perfect for young & old legs to get to sights. I had requested a quiet, clean Twin room with ensuite for my son & I & that is what we got. We were also happy we accepted the offer of a transfer to the Hotel from the airport. Worth the extra euros. We didn't have a laptop, so Anda kindly allowed us to use the hotel one when needed. Via della Croce is a really nice street to start your Roman adventure & we really enjoyed the breakfast bar on the corner to the right of the hotel(as you face out). All in all, a very good value hotel & we would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Wesam316
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to go to Rome in November and we stayed at hotel panda after we read the great reviews about it .. and we were not let down by it .. the hotel location was great .. near the Spanish steps and the metro. The Staff is so helpful .. Anda and Sophia were our main contacts and they always found a way to help us .. eaither by calling someone or showing us what to do .. there is a nice place next to the hotel to have breakfast in we had the best chocolate corasant we had ever eaten :) beware of this street though as most of its shop would take 2 euros for a small bottle of water .. anyway this hotel had everything we wanted for the price we paid .. so no complains at all .. oh not to forget that our room was great always clean but dont expect a view if u want to sleep well .

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tpauw
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of Hotel Panda, near the Spanish steps. We could walk to the Colloseum and the Vatican, and it's near the Metro (A). We had a room at the side of the street (via della croce), so it was a little noisy; ear plugs will help if you're not used to street noises. But the room was good and clean. I would recommend it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Dandelion35
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and were very pleased. The location was perfect, especially for the value. It was in walking to Spagna metro, Spanish steps, Ara Pacis, Pantheon, Trevi, Piazza Popolo and Navona and we even walked back from the Colosseum area. The shopping and cafes for gelato/granite were excellent. There were two of us, but we got a room with a private bathroom and extra loft area that gave us plenty of room and a nice window view to the street. We ate breakfast at the downstairs restaurant D'Angelos for 5 euro with vouchers provided by the front desk, which was for a croissant, coffee and juice. We also often stopped in the restaurant for dessert or water when heading back to our room. The staff was very helpful with maps, directions to use the bus, and a laptop that guests can use in the lobby. It was a walk-up, but not too bad, and I was traveling while four months pregnant. The TV had the BBC Worldnews channel, so occasional downtime in the room was fine. Trucks make deliveries on the street outside pretty early, but this didn't bother me. We really enjoyed the level of comfort and the location for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_s80
Reviews.Content: I booked hotel panda based on the solo traveler's reviews and I could not have been more pleased! I was expecting something much more "bare bones", but Hotel Panda was perfect for me! The room was VERY clean, had a little closet that fit all my things and a small desk. My room was perfect for one! I don't know if I would stay in the room with another person to be honest (my stuff filled the closet). The bathroom was very narrow, but I didn't have a problem with it as I'm only 5"6. I had no trouble with the air conditioner...I'm guessing whoever did wasn't very patient with the controller. The a/c goes off when you turn off the power (no surprise there), so you have to make sure to turn it on each time you enter. The one negative thing involves the shared bathrooms. I was in room 23, which is next door to the bathrooms...so I definitely heard movement late at night and in the early mornings. I didn't mind so much as I'm a late night person, but the location of your room is definitely something to consider. Also, the hotel is on two floors of the building, the second and third floors. I was so happy that I had used my pack instead of a suitcase!! The hotel is approximately 3 minutes to the Spanish steps, the small roads are filled with restaurant options, there is a grocery store around the corner and there is high end shopping all around. The hotel is also right beside one of the main roads in Rome, the Corso, and so it is very easy to navigate your way to all of the sites. I was pleasantly surprised to find that there is someone working the front desk 24 hours/day and there was free wifi. I felt safe at all times at this hotel. The front desk staff were very helpful and 2/3 spoke English very well :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: angken
Reviews.Content: Hotel Panda was absoluterly fantastic. We booked a room with private bathroom. For 100 euros we were so pleased with our room. The Location Location Location is fantastic in a great little street right near the Spanish Steps and main strip shopping. Breakfast is not included but right up the street there is a magnificent place that does coffee and a sweet where all the local italians stop on the way to work. Definatly would recommend you book this hotel. Although we couldnt get wireless connection in the room it worked in there Reception foyer. We thought it was great value for money

Reviews.Title: “Good for backpacking”
Reviews.Author: travelreview7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of days because our first choice B&B couldn't keep us on for an extra couple of nights due to being booked out, so as a last minute option (we booked the day before) it was a welcome relief - it's really clean, quiet and inexpensive considering the location. Having said all that, the room was dark & small and we didn't manage to figure out the air con so it was like a furnace. This place is a godsend if you are on a budget and want somewhere reasonable and clean. But if you are looking for a place with ambience and a room to lounge about in, this is not for you. If you are going to pound the pavement in Rome from dawn to dusk and just rest your head here, then it will do just fine (if you figure out the air con that is!)

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: DanPMG
Reviews.Content: Small, nicely decorated hotel right in the middle of Rome. Highly recommended for a weekend stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small but nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Frankie2213
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a double with a private bathroom over the Christmas holiday. Even during this holiday season the price was very reaosnable. The room was a little small, but pretty typical for European standards, and was very clean and quite. Our private bathroom met all our needs as well. Nothing special in terms of amenaties, but you know what you are getting with a place like this. Well worth the great price, especially for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good one”
Reviews.Author: Ilyasou
Reviews.Content: We had a room with common bathroom. Pros : Cheap if you look at the location. Room was very clean, very quiet, small, with a tiny window, but somehow managed to get plenty of light during the day. Excellent bed too! :) Staff was nice. Free wifi. Cons : Bathroom was well equipped, even though really narrow.

Reviews.Title: “Clean small rooms in a great location”
Reviews.Author: greek_spanish
Reviews.Content: If what you want is a central, clean and comfy place to stay in Rome this is great. It is the ideal hotel for someone traveling on a budget in Rome. It is that generally Rome is really expensive to stay. We had a room with a common shower, again bathroom is very narrow, but perfectly clean and taken care of. The room had a sink which was good. If you like us spend all your day outside sightseeing and just needed a place to rest and wash up, this is your place. If you want somewhere to spend a bit more time in the room then maybe not.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very small double room, spotless, €80/night, excluding breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Whareroa
Reviews.Content: Located on an atmospheric pedestrianised cobblestone street, minutes away from the Spanish Steps, this is a good option if you're seeking simple, clean, no frills accommodation in Rome. We stayed in room 16 for two nights in late September 2009 – a quiet, very small double with shared bathroom facilities. There were two bathrooms on our floor which were clean and were both available each time we went to use them. Be prepared to haul your luggage up several flights of stairs, for the very small rooms and mixed temperaments of the staff, but overall it makes a great base for exploring Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest room I ever slept in!”
Reviews.Author: kate28California
Reviews.Content: Great location, very clean, but tiny tiny room. We stayed in many a hotel in europe, and this was the smallest. We didn't spend much time in there anyway though, so who cares?

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lbenitez
Reviews.Content: Pros: The staff is friendly. The location is very central; walking distance to all the attractions. The room is kept clean and the towels are changed daily. You're right by the shopping district so you can do plenty of shopping. You also have the metro station 2 min away if you need one. The price is the cheapest you'll find for the value. There are plenty of restaurants and even a supermarket if you want a more economical option. Cons: You have to walk up some stairs to get to the hotel; it's actually on the 3rd floor of the building. The rooms do not have a TV or Radio. This might not matter for most, but there isn't a full length mirror in the room. Bottom line ... You won't find a more economical place to stay with such a great location. If you plan on not spending time in your room and you're a low maintenance person, this is where you should stay. Otherwise, search for a place with amenities.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem--wonderful location, clean and comfortable room, good value, great staff”
Reviews.Author: emily1108
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended for the no-frills, semi-budget traveler! This was such a great place in a perfect location! It's on a pedestrian street, just a short walk to the metro (get off at Piazza Spangolo, walk out of the alley from the metro, Via della Croce is in the far right corner across the piazza). The Spanish Steps were just around the corner. We walked easily to the Trevi Fountain (about 10 minutes) and the Panthanon (about 15 minutes) from the hotel, and because we were really motivated to walk, went ahead and walked to the Forum and Coloseum (about 45 minutes minutes). We took the metro to the Vatican. We took a taxi (there is a stand right in the piazza) to Termini Train Station for about 9 euros. Just FYI for first time Italy travelers--ask the taxi driver the estimated price for your destination BEFORE you even get into the taxi (otherwise, you may get the "scenic route"). The staff at this hotel were incredibly helpful (answered our questions about taxis and public transportation, helped me call the rental car company to confirm, kept our bags for the day when we checked out, etc.). Staff were also efficient and friendly, and spoke very good English. The room and building were very secure. Our room was in the back, and looked into a rather bland courtyard. It was very, very quiet for being the middle of Rome. Beds were just okay, but we were so tired, we slept well. The room and bathroom were clean, but a bit cramped (we weren't in there much anyway). The room had air conditioning (we had to ask for the remote at the front desk and they didn't charge us for it, even though the guide book said it would be a few euros a day). The televison had one English channel. The street was loaded with great places to eat for all budgets (we ate at the pizza/pasta restaurant just to the right when facing the front door of the hotel, which was a good, cheap meal and staff spoke English). There are also little grocery stores, carry out places, bars/coffee shops and a fruit stand on this block. Just FYI for first time Italy travelers--at a bar (where they serve expresso and capucinno, and you can get a pastry), it is usually less than one euro for the expresso if you stand at the counter to drink it, but it will be 2-3 euros if you sit down to drink it as a service charge. The only part that was a little weird about the hotel was that our room had this constant slight vibration that seemed to come through the floor. We weren't sure what was underneath us, but it was actually kind of relaxing, even though it kept making us think our cell phone was vibrating in our bag!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms in small hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: mangobing
Reviews.Content: I found this place fairly last minute, but they had a good deal on a doppia. The room was tiny but well-furnished. It was a bit nicer than many of the budget places I'd stayed in. The place was pretty quiet when we were there, and the tiny shared bathrooms were very clean. They provided soap but not shampoo, so you might want to bring your own. They do have nice towels. The location is great, steps from the Spagna metro and of course, the steps themselves. Lots of shops and restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and well located”
Reviews.Author: melifara
Reviews.Content: We had small room with shared bathroom - and the only minus of this hotel is that it is really small. I feeled a little bit claustrophobiс at night, but i have no complaints. They honestly write about its size, so we were ready. Perfect location and nice design.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: chubes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Panda for 2 nights. Decent and clean, though room was small. Location was great as it is close to the shopping area and the restaurants/cafes around the hotel serve good food. What we hated were the stairs that lead to Reception and rooms, and the service at the Reception. The lady's pet line was "I don't know". That aside, we will be back, given the good location.

Reviews.Title: “It is good enough”
Reviews.Author: RoseCityDuck
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying this, I don't require much in a room. Clean and some what quiet is all I need and when it comes to clean my standards maybe less than others. Lets take Hotel Panda for example. The room was very clean - no complaints there. However that could not be said for the bed and let me further break that down. Sheets - clean, pillows - clean, comforter - ehhhhh, there was room for improvement. To put it politely there appeared to be love stains on the comforter. While it bugged my wife and it initially grossed me out, we just rotated the comforter to put the "dirty end" at our feet. We probably should have complained, but I honestly didn't care. I know it sounds gross and as I write this realize it was pretty darn gross, but I guess at the time I figured that the stain looked pretty old and why bother making a fuss when you can just turn the comforter around. Out of sight out of mind. Out of all the various places I have stayed in Italy this is the one place I would not recommend and oddly enough it has nothing to do with the love stained comforter. I was not impressed with the area around the Spanish Steps. I found the entire area to be over priced (with the exception of Hotel Panda). I would suggest staying somewhere near the Trevi Fountain or the Pantheon. Those neighborhoods are much more reasonable in terms of overall expenses. But if you insist on staying near the Spanish Steps and you don't want to pay much I would recommend Hotel Panda in spite of the loved stained comforter (room 27)

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: Bec_and_daz
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Central, vibrant location - Clean and secure - Great price for Rome considering location - Sink in room Cons: - Very small room - Sep. toilet and shower in cheaper rooms - Basic room with no TV - No internet facilities

Reviews.Title: “Braw wee place”
Reviews.Author: debbieham1
Reviews.Content: Panda was enthusiastically recommended to us for our trip for my hubby's 50th. Great wee hotel. Our room had it's own welcoming statue with a spiral staircase up to the bed area which was so quirky and cute (room 36). Bathroom was also very charming but not for the taller amongst us. My teenage daughter loved it as well. Fab location with great restaurants in the street below. We enjoyed the cafe across the street to the left on the corner, Taz I think it was called. Serve a nice glass on wine for 3.50 euros which is hard to find in Rome, with complimentary olives and crisps if you ask. We also had a great meal at AL34 round the corner, great food and service at reasonable prices. In case you don't already know if you want to visit the Vatican you can book direct with them on the web, without a tour, for the entrance fee plus 4 euros booking fee each person. Beats waiting in the queues. Have a great time in a very beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, great staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Justjoan27
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews of this hotel we decided to stay here. The rooms are small but very clean and very charming. The photos you see of the hotel do not do it justice. The location is amazing!!!! You step outside and you are in the middle of Rome. Close to everything the Spanish steps are just 2 blocks away. There are cafes and wine bars up and down the street and the shopping in this neighborhood is great! I would recommend this hotel to everyone I know and next time I am in Rome I will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Pensione, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hartski
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Rome and liked the Panda's quiet rooms and great location that after staying there during our first days we booked again for our return at the end of our trip. We had a double room with shared bath which was pretty small, but compared to the price quotes we got elsewhere in the centro storico we were content. We've had smaller in NYC and Hong Kong. If you need more space you can book a room with a bathroom. The rooms, bathrooms and halls were always very clean. We kept reading about how noisy Rome is and how difficult it is to find a quiet hotel so we were surprised the Panda was so quiet and we never used the earplugs we brought along for that reason. For us the location was perfect...a small street 2 blocks from the Spanish Steps (and Metro). The Pantheon was only a 10 min walk but if felt worlds away...where the Pantheon to Trevi pedestrian walkway was mobbed with tourists and stalls selling junk, Via della Croce had several restaurants, shops, coffee and a supermarket just around the corner. Plenty just outside the door without being in the midst of crowds. The staff was efficient.. Bathrooms were always available, clean, good pressure and plenty of hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a Roman”
Reviews.Author: MiaMomML
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have been happier with this pensione. The room was small, but clean and the bed was comfortable. There were two full bathrooms down the hall, and they were always clean and available (no waiting), plus we had a sink in our room. The location was wonderful, very close to the Spanish Steps, which we visited every night. Close to the Spagna metro stop, but close enough to most tourist sites to walk (Rome is a very walkable city). The pension was on a sweet little street, with many restauants that set up outdoor tables every night. This hotel did not include breakfast, but half a block down was a fruit stand, and everywhere you looked you could find a place for coffee and pastries. If you are going in the summer, make sure you request the air conditioner, which costs extra. We found the rooms to be quiet and more than satisfactory. This was also a great value. My only complaint was that the staff was not helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: ebinyc
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location, the room was charming but small, and the bathroom was nice - even had a statue in it. Basically, it was nicer than I expected given the price. It did have air conditioning, but it took hours to cool off the room. After a long day of sightseeing in August this was not appreciated! It was bare bones but clean and acceptable until our last night when we came back to a horrid stench. It was beyond terrible and truly indescribable... We quickly learned that it was coming from the bathroom, and after shutting the door and opening the window it was fine, as long as you weren't in the bathroom! We didn't alert the staff because it was extremely late and we wanted nothing more than to sleep. I'm glad we didn't contact anyone, because I was really offended by the treatment we received the next morning when checking out. I was confused about the price and I admit that I was wrong - but this woman was outrageously rude. It wasn't what she said, but how she said it that was quite surprising - she treated me with sheer disgust. I am not exaggerating either- this was the worst treatment I have ever received at a hotel or otherwise. I could forgive a plumbing issue or weak air conditioning, but I cannot forgive the blatant disrespect I received at Hotel Panda. For this reason, I would not recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but there are better places.”
Reviews.Author: globeguru
Reviews.Content: I read positive things about Panda on the nytimes and tripadvisor, but I was definitely upset with it. It has a great location, but Rome in august (and year round) has lots of great deals in the historic center. I came with my brother and we were supposed to be in a double room but there was so problem with the reservation so the woman told me (in Italian, which I speak fluently) that she would show me a smaller room they had a available and we could take a look. The room was TINY. My brother and I couldn't both stand in it at the same time. So the woman very nicely explained that someone new was starting the shift and she could assist us. The new woman told me this is what I booked and just yelled at me in English saying I must not have understood Italian at all. The former woman tried to explain the situation but the whole event resulted in us saying we needed a better room. She gave us a nice double with bathroom but for 90 euros, which no longer makes the place or the location a steal at all. I lived in Rome for years, trust me there are better places by the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon or the Roman Forum. The room has air conditioning (an absolute necessity for Roman summers) but nothing else worth recommending. It's not a bad place--it's just that SO many other options exist that I'm sure would work better. And no internet...

Reviews.Title: “Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jaltas
Reviews.Content: Visited Rome with 3 x 18 yr old boys. Was originally concerned the tours were not going to hold their interest. Thankfully the wonderful guide Ian at Through Eternity had their interest from the first moment. We all enjoyed the experience. This was my 3rd trip to Rome and the one I have enjoyed the most. To be shown around and not have to queue means you see so much more. Friends we travelled with felt prior to tour that the cost of tour was expensive. Post tour they agreed that it was wonderful and an invaluable experience. Through Eternity was very professional in email contact which helped us get organised before arriving. Can also recommend Panda Hotel. Great location and the people are very nice and helpful. No need to worry that breakfast not included as cafes close and supermarket in nearby laneway. Beds really comfortable and the place is spotless. Some rooms are quite decent in size, some very small. If I went back I would ask for the room our boys had. Big with balcony. I think it might have been no. 27 or 28. Our room was very small but still enjoyed the Rome cobbled street atmosphere so would stay again no matter the room size.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: DFB77
Reviews.Content: Great little pensione located perfectly for exploring the best that Rome has to offer. Bathrooms very clean. Comfortable bed. Airconditioned - which is important during a Rome summer. Staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, not always convenient advise from staff”
Reviews.Author: burners4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed four nights at the Hotel Panda in a room that didn't have a bath. We really enjoyed our stay. The linens were wonderful and we never had to wait to use the bathroom. It was very quiet (we had room 17). My ONLY frustration was the lack of convenient advise from staff on questions about a place to use the internet and see a movie. They sent us 15 blocks away to use the internet and were going to send us to Travestre to see an American movie. There is a great little movie place 3 blocks from the hotel that plays both English and Italian speaking movies. It was a great relaxing things to do late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place, Perfect location, Perfect price”
Reviews.Author: MandMMelbourne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 7 nights and although we too were hesitant staying here after reading previous reviews, we walked into our Room No 37 and could not have been more surprised. It was at the end of the hallway,very quiet and nicely furnished. It was huge for european standards with a king sized bed and a spare single, and a window that opened out to a balcony (great for any washing you needed to hang out and dry). The bathroom was extremely tiny and I pity anyone that drops their soap in the shower as its a massive exercise to pick it up (you need to get out of the shower to give yourself room to bend!!). There was no TV which wasnt a huge blow but it would have been nice to have one when at the end of the day you were too tired to want to do anything else but watch TV. The rooms were cleaned every day and towels replaced. The staff on the reception desk were pleasant - not overly friendly but helpful. Keeping your luggage in mind - there is a lift but it only starts after climbing one set of stairs and stops on a mezzanine level so you either have to climb up or down one set of stairs to get to reception. Location was perfect and so was the price so we were extremely happy and would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting good value accommodation right in the heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: luvly9
Reviews.Content: In the central area, near the Spanish steps in a street lined with cafes and close to most of the main sites. For the price, 78 euros for a double you'll be hard pressed to get better value. The room was very tiny (disappointed at first sight but got over it as you only go there to sleep!). Probably the negative would be having to hump your luggage up the stairs. Rooms clean and it wasn't such a hardship having to share a bathroom. For a higher price you can get a room with private bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “great find in Rome, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: NjTravel_hound
Reviews.Content: We were two adults, two kids, stayed in 1.5 height ensuite room with a sleeping platform on top for kids, super. Lovely staff, fantastic location in the heart of Rome, and unbeatable prices. Easy to see why it has near legend status on the various savvy traveler sites.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option, tiny hotel, GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: CBop
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights here in June and thought it was a nice, budget option in a fantastic neighbourhood. The hotel is located a 2 minute walk from the Piazza Spagna and 3 minutes from the Spagna subway station, and as a result we were able to take the Metro everywhere in Rome, which made the massive city much more navigable for us (we found all of Rome fairly walkable, but some of the neighbourhoods are not as close to the Metro lines). It is right in the ritzy Via Condotti shopping district, with many restaurants and shops just below, a lovely place to take a stroll at night. We stayed in a double room with private bathroom - this had a king-sized bed, no TV, it was basic and clean. The room itself was not overly small, but the bathroom was quite tiny (the shower is certainly built for smaller-sized individuals, it was a bit of a gymnastics routine even getting into the shower door, larger individuals beware). We had asked for a room with air-conditioning (an extra 6 Euros per night) - and although they mixed this up, it was no problem getting the remote for the air-conditioner that was in the room already. A small problem was that our air-conditioner was supposed to be connected to a sensor and turn off when the window was opened - ours was somehow programmed backwards and turned off when the window was closed. In 35 degree temperatures, we could not have BOTH the window closed and the air conditioner off, so we had to keep the window a crack open to have the air conditioner on, which means much of the noise from Via della Croce below filtered into our bedroom (when we did close the window though, they were quite soundproof). However, I actually quiet enjoyed taking a siesta and listening to the chatter of bella Roma below (earplugs worked for the evenings, and my husband sleeps through anything). There is no breakfast, but D'Angelo's just on the corner serves the best pastries we had in Italy, there is also a supermarket up one block and a small alimentieri across from D'Angelo's. On the last morning when we went to pay, their Visa machine was not working, so we had to run around the corner to find an ATM and pay in cash. This can happen everywhere though, of course. We would stay again, especially because of the amazing location.

Reviews.Title: “Filth, Bugs, Fumes, Attempted Overcharge, Uncomfy Futon, Slow Wireless, & Loud Music= Never Again”
Reviews.Author: dummy_girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2+ weeks, and the Hotel Panda was the worst hotel experience of our lives. My best friend stayed at a youth hostel in Berlin, which was much better for a fraction of the price and compared Hotel Panda to a youth hostel in Rio, which cost even less than the Berlin hostel. We have also stayed at an infinitely better place for less in Tokyo, the most expensive city in the world, and we live in NY, the second most expensive city in the world. We have also stayed at 4 star hotels in San Fran for the same price. In 2+ weeks, the bedsheets were only changed twice during our stay (you can tell, cause the sheets get wrinkled, and clean sheets are crisp), the towels were also not changed on a daily basis (they even just took a towel that was on the floor and placed it on top of the other towels on the towel bar), the sink was only cleaned once after 2 weeks, and the floor and everything else not at all. On a daily basis, someone only made the bed and took out the trash. The shower tiles were filthy, and there were puddles on the bathroom floor. They also ran out of toilet paper and had no replacement roll at one point. The only thing provided in the room were 2 small packages of harsh soap. The room is miniscule (and I'm coming from the viewpoint of a New Yorker used to the tiniest closet apartments in the states). The "double" bed was actually the size of a twin, and the room wasn't much bigger than the "bed," which was actually a futon placed against the wall, which had a wooden board glued/nailed on it to make it look like a headboard. The futon dipped in the middle. The pillows were also so uncomfortable that I slept without one the entire time. I was expecting the size of the room, but the uncleanliness was ridiculous. I found a dead bug on the bed the first day and another kind of insect crawling on the floor a couple weeks later. The front desk said that the free wireless can only be used by your own laptop in the lobby. It took half an hour to load one site, and one of the sites never loaded. Most of the stay the internet was slower than molasses. We're talking way slower than dial up. Only on one day was it working properly. Around 1 am one night, we smelled fumes so harsh that we, along with others in the building in rooms facing the courtyard, were coughing uncontrollably. We had to leave the hotel for half an hour til the fumes cleared. We called and went to the front desk, who later told us that the restaurant next door had some guys (who were wearing gas masks) spray mosquito spray in the courtyard. On another night, the same restaurant blasted music til 12:30 am, which is the time the front desk told us that they were allowed to blast music til. At checkout, the front desk attempted to charge an additional night and charge for using the phone in the room when I had been told that using the phone was free as long as I called the local access number on my phone card. Needless to say, they failed. The hotel is located near the Spagna subway station. It's located in a safe and clean but touristy neighborhood. My best friend recommends the nearest cafe for the best cappuccinos and double espressos in the neighborhood- the guy in the red vest serves sandwiches, drinks, and pastries at the counter. Beware of the closest bar/pizzeria that's open late- the cashier claimed my bill (which I bought from the bank here in the states) was counterfeit and tried to take it. Like that's gonna work on a New Yorker. Also, the bartender, who took awhile searching for a certain beer for the Italian customer before us, tried to just give my best friend the first beer he found instead of what he asked for. I'll definitely never stay at this filthy hotel again. I have no idea why it's recommended by anyone. A third world youth hostel was cleaner than this.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: lmm28
Reviews.Content: After leaving the Spagna train station we easily found Via della Croce and our Hotel. We stayed at Pensione Panda. Check in was easy. We didn't think our room would be ready, we were just going to leave the bags, but it was ready so we changed and cleaned up a bit and then headed out. I have very mixed feelings about Pensione Panda. The hotel is in a great location. We easily walked to must of the major sites and it was nice to have the train station as well as buses nearby. The first room we had was #20, a double room with a bathroom, which was right next to the check in desk and steps to go outside. It's window opened up right over the main street. Of course we slept with the window open it being pretty warm in Rome. That night was so bad for me. The noise on the street all night long was way too loud. That morning I asked if there were any quieter rooms and with no problem at all they let us move to #36. which was all the way at the end of the hall. It had a little spiral staircase to go up and had an additional bed for a third person. The room was larger, the bathroom was larger too. It had nice exposed wood beams. The window opened out to just other buildings and courtyards and it was amazing how much quieter it was. We had a very uneventful stay there From 9/11 - 9/15. The room was always cleaned, new towels, firm yet comfortable bed, etc. We paid 108 euros/night and I made the reservations directly via email about 8 months in advance. Here's where the trouble came.... I also had made reservations (at the same time) for our last night in Italy 9/24 with them. When leaving on 9/15 I confirmed that with them. I also called from Capri on 9/23 to let them know I would be arriving around 10 pm on 9/24. Wouldn't you know that when we arrived on 9/24 at 9:45 and checked in they gave us the keys for #26. We walked into the room to find a tiny single bed. I had in writing that I had reserved a double room. The man said that was the room that was assigned to me by the woman who runs the hotel, and that there were no other rooms available. I of course demanded as nicely as possible that something must be done about this. He made a few calls and found us another hotel to stay at in our price range, called a cab and gave us 20 euro to pay for it. We arrived at the other Hotel - Hotel Azzura near the Barberini Metro stop around 10:45 pm, the ride cost 13 euro. The man who runs the hotel, Renato, was very nice. However the hotel was very old, rundown, on a dirty street with not so nice looking people hanging around outside. We told him we needed to leave at 6 am which lead him to instructing us how to open the doors since they would be locked for the night at midnight. I asked about a wake up call and he pretended not to understand. We were starving and had been traveling all day, so we headed out to get something to eat. He said we needed to be back by midnight. I was so looking forward to this last night of our trip and our last night in Rome and now I couldn't even stay out late and see the city. When we got back at midnight I asked Renato in Italian about a wake up call, and he said he didn't do those, and he'd be sleeping at 6 am. He proceeded to take 30 mins to find me a tiny little clock, that wound up not alarming at all. We paid 100 euro for this room. I am so upset that after being a good customer at Panda and already having paid them for 4 nights, making reservations in advance, confirming countless times, them not having my room and then having them force me to stay at a place they had to know was not the greatest, was just inexcusable. Other hotels know things about other hotels, right?? The guy did try at Panda I suppose, he gave us the 20 euro, and apologized and really it wasn't his fault as he just worked the desk but still. Businesses shouldn't be that way. I've taken many trips (this being my 2nd to Italy and 3rd to Europe) and never had something like this happen.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for at Hotel Panda”
Reviews.Author: alwaysevol000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Panda for 4 nights during our honeymoon in May 2009. We knew going in that we were staying at the Hotel Panda because it was cheap and we liked the location. That being said I can say little good about the place besides it was clean, had a nice location, and was somewhat quiet. Our room didn’t have a clock, radio, or tv which was fine, but it was literally a bed, night stand and chair in the room. Kind of like a clean prison cell (from what I have heard)! You had to buzz out twice to leave the building and I joked to my wife that it seemed we were buzzing out of jail. Also, our hallway had a funky odor. The front desk staff was somewhat dysfunctional and I never saw the same person twice. They also weren’t very friendly. I asked about the internet and they said I would need to come to the lobby to get a signal (the lobby was smaller than my bedroom with a weird couch…seemed like a college apartment). We will probably return to Rome again, but we would surely upgrade from the Hotel Panda. If you need a clean room in a nice location for 100 euro a night… its not to shabby.

Reviews.Title: “Great locaion and decent room, but small.”
Reviews.Author: rkEuroTrip09
Reviews.Content: Great location to Spanish steps, and close to the metro. Good neighborhood. Room was TINY!!!!! Dirty floor, otherwise clean, but that was the norm for the hotels we stayed in during our month long stay. Good bathroom, small shower typical of European hotels. Little pricy for the room we got. We stayed in much nicer places for less--although not in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “NOT too good to be true! Loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jenny15X
Reviews.Content: I was pretty hesitant to stay at this hotel – frankly it seemed too good to be true. I think I read about it in my Lets Go! travel book. It was priced way below the rates I found for other hotels in this area. But traveling alone it was important to me to stay in a very populated area – which was why I was fixated on this location right near to the Spanish Steps and a block away from the metro. I was pleasantly surprised! My room was REALLY cute, with a nice sink and mirror, and some sort of tile detail. The hotel is located on I think the second floor of a building that it shares with some other businesses. The room was very clean and nicely decorated. The bathroom was really clean and really nice. My room had a shared bathroom but there was never anyone in it when I went to use it/shower. The people at the reception desk were really kind and helpful. They gave me some pretty explicit directions to the Borghese Gallery, booked a taxi for me, and even let me use their personal laptop when I came back defeated because I couldn’t find the internet café they gave me directions to. When I asked the reception desk attendant point blank why their fabulous little hotel was priced so much lower than its neighbors, he replied to me, “We don’t exaggerate”. Sounds good to me. There’s also a great little jewelry shop across the way from the hotel, selling trendy and not too expensive necklaces (20 Euro), earrings, and bracelets. It was called LALA Italia. And a really good restaurant on the same street that I ate at, it was recommended in my Rick Steves book. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but bring your ear plugs.”
Reviews.Author: cazzi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights the beginning of April, as we read about it in Lonely Planet...as a budget accom. for 80-100 euro p/night. For a family of 4, (8 & 14) we paid 180 euro which was 360 Australian per night - so not cheap, but I guess good value(?) for Rome. The room we had was #31, right over the street..which is great ambiance, but at night VERY noisy...you can also hear people snoring, talking, jumping etc in rooms next door and above..luckily we had earplugs, or we would never have been able to sleep. The room was very clean with a tiny ensuite...no coffee in the room (bummer) or tv - very basic, and upstairs were 2 single beds for our kids. The location is 2 minutes from the Spanish Steps and the poshest shopping district in Rome. It is a great base...but you don't want to stay here if you want to spend time in your room. Its a place to sleep (with ear plugs)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice little room”
Reviews.Author: Ape2658
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on tripadvisor, I expected to find small rooms. This was not that much of a problem for me and my husband. We had a nice double bed. The bathroom was a good size. We were in room #20, which was the first one next to the check in desk. It was a little noisy in the morning, but any other time we hardly noticed. The location was perfect. 2 blocks from the Spanish Steps and 3 blocks from Rome's shopping hotspot. The Spanga underground was next to the Spanish Steps, this makes getting around simple.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, but there's a reason why”
Reviews.Author: Austin_TexasRedhead
Reviews.Content: Located just minutes from the Spanish steps and the Spagna metro station and in the heart of the shopping district, the site is great, with a fabulous restaurant (L'Antica Enoteca) across the street. We had an extremely small room with bunk beds. With two suitcases and two people we struggled with a tiny closet and no room to manuver. Staff was not the most friendly, although did assist with specific requests when asked, such as reservations for local sites and train information. Sheets and towels were rough, and bathroom not the cleanest but certainly acceptable. We visited in February and the bathroom was so hot after a shower I sweltered -- can't imagine what it would be like in the summer. Price is right for sure, but be prepared to tough out a few small inconviences.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location but dont get an en suite room”
Reviews.Author: draul
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is superb. The room was clean and the staff friendly. A no frills place that is very good value considering its upmarket location. However we stayed in a room in which the bathroom while clean, stank of a gas like smell of what I presume is chemical cleaning. On the first night we stayed we were awoken around 01.30 by a tremendous noise which sound like the wall had come crashing down behind the headboard. We reasoned it was someone flushing a toilet and the sound was of water gushing through the pipe behind our bed. This was to continue every time someone used that toilet. The following night at 05.30 we were awoken by someone having a shower which was located beside our bed on the other side of a paper thin wall. This continued for an hour. I am aware Rome is noisy I have visited before but I had not expected this. The room was on the right close to reception so ask for a room on the second floor. The hotel is located very close to Piazza di Spagna in a beautiful but pricey area of Rome. Avoid the wine bars unless you are willing to spend €8 for a beer and €9 for a G&T. Do try the restaurants on the Via del Croce they are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Base to Explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: metayelet8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days in September. We reserved a room with a private bathroom, and while the shower was on the small side, we were satisfied with our stay. You cannot find a more affordable, comfortable place to stay in the center of Rome. We were able to walk everywhere from here -- from Piazza del Popolo in the north to the Colosseum in the south. In the mornings, we just stepped out into the street and walked two doors over for a cappucinos and pastries, for a total of 3 or 4 euros. Great location, great value, but the only downside would be for older or disabled travelers, as you must climb two flights of stairs to reach the hotel. There is an elevator, but it was not working when we checked in. If you can maneuver the stairs, then I would highly recommend Hotel Panda.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - great location, good price!”
Reviews.Author: CZAustralia
Reviews.Content: Thank you trip advisor for pointing me in the direction of this fabulous pensione, located a two-minute walk from the Spanish Steps. I was expecting a "hotel" and could easily have missed the entrance to this apartment-style building. The reception is located on the 2nd or 3rd floor, although a lift helps you up part of the way. We had a very generously sized room, right next to the reception desk. The room was usually a quad room, but there was only two of us. We had our own bathroom. The rate was VERY reasonable for Rome. The disadvantage was that there was poor noise insulation, which resulted in us being woken by reception activity early in the morning. There is no breakfast served at the pensione, but if you walk down the street (toward Via Del Corso) for 1 minute, you will find a great cafe that sells delicious pastries and serves good coffee. If you get your coffee "per portare via" (or to go), then it is very reasonably priced and you could enjoy sitting on the Spanish Steps as you eat your breakfast. The cleanliness was of a high standard. Staff were friendly and helpful. Getting to the hotel is very easy. From the airport, catch the train to Termini, and then the metro to the Spanish Steps (Spagna). Exit the station in the direction of Spanish Steps. When you reach the piazza, the hotel is in the street that comes off the piazza in the far right (with your back towards the steps!). I look for cleanliness, location and reasonable price when booking accommodation, and this pensione definitely fit the bill. Overall, a very pleasant experience, and I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SnazzyShopper
Reviews.Content: We were somewhat disappointed by our stay in Hotel Panda as I booked the accomodation after reading the great reviews on Tripadvisor. Firstly the room was tiny (however they told us when booking that it was a small double room) but it was clean. The price was fantastic - 78 euro for double room per night, 390 euro for 5 nights in the centre of Rome! We had a shared bathroom, which was fine (however there were some hairs in the shower!), but one of the bathrooms on our corridor was out of order as it was being tiled. Unfortunately, this bathroom was right beside our room and I felt we should have been informed of this. Work started extremely early for 3 of the 5 mornings we were there with the result that we were woken very early on these mornings by drills etc. The workmen and cleaners were also very noisy with the result that it was very hard to sleep past 7 or 8 in the morning. The receptionist also was not very friendly or helpful - we asked her for some directions on the first morning and she quite impolitely gave us some very vague directions. As the room was small & hot, we had to sleep with the window open but they had a tumbler dryer operating in their utility room for practically the whole night. The bed was also uncomfortable as it had several hollows in it. The central location and price really are the best features of this property. My advice is avoid room 13 and go for a bigger room with an ensuite in this pensione.

Reviews.Title: “Teeny Tiny Shower”
Reviews.Author: DivaCarol
Reviews.Content: First, let me say the location is fabulous. You are really in the heart of the Spanish Steps area, if that's what you like. The hotel was okay, but we probably would not stay here again. Everyone who worked there was very friendly and accomodating. We had a double room with bathroom at 108 Euro per night, plus 6 Euro a day for AC. It was a very nice and clean room, but the shower was almost too small to fit in. I literally had to slide in sideways and flatten some of my "parts" to make it work. My fiance had to go in sideways because of his shoulders. That said, I am a "gifted" girl, but my fiance only wears a medium or large shirt. I know that there are more important things in Rome than shower stalls and that hotel rooms are made in small spaces. But, this was a little too small.
