Also, Hotel Panda was on the 2nd Piano, which is actually our third floor. You have to walk up one flight of stairs to get to the elevator, take it up and then walk down a flight to the hotel. A little confusing, but we got used to it. And finally, the hotel called for a car to take us to the airport, since we had an early flight home. The car cost 47 Euro. During the ride to the Fiumicino Airport, the driver got up to speeds of over 160 km (99mph) many times. He was whipping in and out of traffic like crazy. There was no reason, we weren't late and hadn't said anything. Grateful to be alive, we just paid him and didn't say anything. But, when I arrived home, I immediately e-mailed the Panda to tell them about this and I haven't heard from them since. I was disappointed that they didn't care that we felt unsafe. That is the final reason for my Neutral rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Peterobina
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located near the Spanish Steps, close to good dining and the underground.The room is modest but is good value and reception is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal for Location!”
Reviews.Author: Debsen1
Reviews.Content: This place is a great deal for its location in Rome. It's right near the Spanish Steps as central to many things as well as subway station. We were in the heart of the city and near many shops and cafes. The only things to be aware of are that the showers are small so you must be thin to fit. Also their towels are very thin (not the fluffy kind) which didn't really bother us. They were very helpful in making reservations for us at nearby restaurants and recommending places.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Mzstressball
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Rome holiday where we stayed 5 days at the Hotel Panda. I can honestly say the location of the hotel is fantastic! It was a 5minute walk max to the Spanish Steps. Literally walk out the front door of the building and turn right, walk up the road to the corner and turn right again, you can see the S/Steps in sight with the flowing fountain and its merely a few steps away. The metro is also located up the road which is a bonus for those wanting to use public transport (come out of the alley way it is located in and if you look to your left, there are the S/Steps) though we walked everywhere to appreciate the sights. Now, if you don't like steps, then beware, because the hotel is located up many flights of stairs (see pictures) so if you are travelling light, then you are lucky. Yes there is a lift (teeeeeny tiny lift) but its only on the second flight of stairs, so there is NO escaping the stair climb or descend. Unfortunately for us, we had heavy suitcases (as we had more of Europe to travel) and could barely lift them up those stairs, it was like the stairs Never ended LOL Worse yet, once we finally reached reception and got our room key, we were about to pass out when we saw our room had a spiral staircase hahah what luck! The price of the hotel was reasonable considering that accommodation in Rome is very expensive and the closer you are to monuments, the more things cost, so we were happy at paying 108Euro per night. We also felt very secure in the building, so nothing to worry about, good security, someone always in reception and good room locks. (and you can always turn the lock dial when you go to bed if you dont want to be disturbed in the morning - it gives a red dot on the lock so the cleaners dont knock) The hotel was great - the room was not that big BUT very neat and clean with a double bed and a single bed (Note: the double bed is two singles pushed together) Though very comfortable matress to sleep on. The bathroom in the room was clean and the facilities appeared new which was a bonus (compared to other hotels we have stayed at where the toilets and sink are worn out) The bathroom overall is very small (but people have mentioned that in Italy, they are all the same and sometimes smaller) Nonetheless, we had a shower which provided hot water, and at the end of the day isnt that what you really need? The bath towels...well, they aren't like Aussie towels but you know what, for something that looks like a bed sheet, they are quite absorbent. The room is serviced every day, fresh towels are given, little Lux soaps are stocked up and plenty toilet paper AND if you feel you may runout, simply ask reception or the cleaners and they will stock the bathroom with more. The weather in Rome was a humid 34degrees and counting (and this was already at 10am, imagine the whole day) we really appreciated the air conditioning, though just to let you all know that the temperature setting only goes as low as 24degrees on the remote - not sure why it is permanently set to that because we really would have loved to have it colder, say perhaps 18degrees because it gets really hot in the room and with the humidity, you need it as cold as you can get, especially at night as the heat remains. Oh and the air con wont turn on until the window is shut as they have a sensor trigger. The staff are friendly and helpful, including the manager. Our bathroom lights had blown and he was prompt in buying the bulb the next day and installing it asap, he was a very sweet man. Also the guy on reception when we arrived was so lovely and we didn't get his name, but would like to thank him for being so kind, helpful and polite :) Oh and one last thing, this is merely a room with beds, air con and a bathroom ... NO TV. (don't expect it to be the Ritz or Hilton) Just a simple hotel room. So if you can't sleep at night, ensure you have something to enlighten you ie: book, DS game etc Overall, definitely value for money and would stay there again if I ever returned to Rome (though would not look forward to those stairs hahahhaha)

Reviews.Title: “A Super Deal”
Reviews.Author: Dadsco
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 10 wonderful days in Rome, and were very fortunate in being able to stay at the Pensione Panda. This hotel is probably the best value for the money in Rome. The rooms were nicely appointed and were very comfortable and clean. The hotel is centrally located (only two blocks from The Spanish Steps), the Spagna Metro is close by, and the shopping on the Via del Corso which is a few minutes walk away is truly awesome! Without exception, Anda and the staff at the Pensione Panda were wonderful. They made us feel so very welcome, and they couldn’t do enough for us to make our trip more enjoyable. The staff all spoke English, and they accommodated us in every way they could by assisting us with directions to the sites in Rome, and making our tour and restaurant reservations. If you are looking for economy, cleanliness, quiet rooms with a central location, and helpful staff, the Panda just can’t be beat. We certainly wouldn’t hesitate staying at the Hotel Panda on our next trip to Rome. Our heartfelt thanks to Anda and staff for making our trip to Rome so special! C. & D. McGregor, U.S.A.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for more!!!”
Reviews.Author: nzwestie
Reviews.Content: Hi all We have just returned from overseas and one of our stays was at the Hotel Panda. We stayed for three nights. Double bed, single bed, full bathroom facilities. We loved our stay here and would recommend the hotel in an instant. The location was fantastic. Our group consisted of myself, husband and 15 year old daughter. The shower was a lovely squash for my husband but for 10 minutes a day what does it really matter? Especially since I am small and fit into it perfectly. Definitely stay here. Jacquie

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Panda”
Reviews.Author: mizcoco88
Reviews.Content: Expensive for what it is, no breakfast included, the rooms are fairly small as well. But for Rome, it is probably one of the cheapest places you will find. The location is fantastic, right at the Spanish Steps and a 5 minute walk away from Via del Corso. The bathroom was spotless, nicely tiled, and the rooms are air conditioned, which is appreciated in the middle of summer in Rome. Rooms are nicely done. Staff are not too friendly however, they are there to simply there to take care of payments and check ins/outs.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Prices and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: janfish
Reviews.Content: Found a list of budget hotels on the budgettravel.com website; Panda was one of top choices. (It was also recommended in guide books.) It is about one and a half blocks from the Spanish Steps and the Spagna Metro stop. You can't beat this location for 108 euros per night for a double bed. (You need to pay an extra 15 euros for air conditioning depending on need and the season.) It is up 3 flights of stairs as is typical of smaller hotels; however, they are working on installing a lift. The staff spoke very good English and were very accommodating. They prearranged our reservation to the Galleria Borghese which is a short walk up and above the Spanish Steps (they emailed the confirmation number prior to departing for Italy). We had a room at the back which overlooked an inner courtyard. The room was not large but it was adequate and very clean with an ensuite bathroom and shower. A few steps outside the hotel entrance is a restaurant which has coffee bar with a bakery items for breakfast. Standing up at the bar for your morning cappucino and pastry was fun (less expensive than if you sit at the table and a lot more interesting). My husband and I enjoyed the ambiance there and elsewhere on the hotel's street (Via della Croce) which is filled with sidewalk cafes. I felt lucky to get a reservation, so book early by email, if you are interested .

Reviews.Title: “Best Best Best Location”
Reviews.Author: Kristen24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for the first 2 nights of our 10 night tour of Italy. We could not ask for anything more! the price was great and the location was unbeatable! it is RIGHT around the corner from the metro and the Spanish Steps!! and one of the restuarants RIGHT on the same street as the hotel (same side too) (wish i remembered the name) was the BEST MEAL i have ever had in my whole life!!! we stayed in room 35 (i think) which had plenty of room. Our friends stayed in a different room and it was TINY but they complained and received a discount. The people at the front desk were very helpful. If and when I return to Rome I will not stay ANYWHERE ELSE!

Reviews.Title: “I hate to write this ...”
Reviews.Author: ElenaAP
Reviews.Content: I hate to write this because this place is a great secret. The location was really fantastic ... just a block from the Spanish steps and walking distance to most of the main attractions in Rome: the Colosseum, the Vatican, the Roman Forum, many Piazzas, the Fontana di Trevi ... I could go on!! We arrived at the Hotel Panda via the subway line from the main station and never took it again. The rooms are incredibly small (but hey, it's Europe!), and we opted to share a bathroom. Everything was kept clean and we didn't mind it one bit ... we spent such little time at the hotel that all we wanted to do when we were there was sleep anyway!! Directly across the street was one of our all time favorite places to eat, the Enoteca Antica. The first night there we ate at the bar and ordered a bottle of wine, then a few glasses, then port ... well it was a long night :) The apps were absolutely wonderful!! It was great to be able to stumble home. The only issue I would comment on is the lack of a hotel staff. There was someone to check us in, but every other time I went to the front desk it was vacant. I never needed them for anything that I couldn't handle myself, but I could see it being a problem. And I suppose if you mind a walk-up, this isn't the place for you. But if you want to save money while not sacrificing location ... by all means this is the place to stay. Book early.

Reviews.Title: “Panda was great!”
Reviews.Author: lxs255
Reviews.Content: My husband, 18-year-old daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Panda on the recommendation of a friend who had stayed there previously. We were very pleased with our triple room. The room was very clean and so was the private bath. The room had a queen size bed on the main level and a set of steps up to the loft with a single bed where our daughter slept. As mentioned by previous reviewers, the hotel is close to the Metro Station (we arrived by train) and close to main attractions like Spanish Steps. There were several good places to eat on the same street and it was interesting to watch the happenings below from the hotel window. We found it quiet for sleeping. We also had no trouble finding ATM's and grocery stores nearby. We also found the staff pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “well done penzione”
Reviews.Author: snowgrassflats
Reviews.Content: *great location *small rooms (double w/o WC doesn't really fit 2 people) *tasteful interior *few amenities *affordable We booked this place based on travel guide recommendation. Doing a rudimentary search on prices through the internet, it was one of the better rates around near the city center. That was esp. important given the ever plummetting dollar (*sigh*). It was the 1st time I've been to Rome so i don't have much to compare to, but overall I was not disappointed. It's 3 blocks from the Spanish Steps and the metro of a street with lots of shopping and places to eat. The interior is tastefully done and clean. The 1st night we stayed in a room w/WC. There was a lot of real wood trims and a nice painted ceiling. The decorations were a lot nicer than the things you would find in American hotels. Of course the main difference was the size, but i was expecting that. The second night we switched to a room that shared a bath. This room was even smaller (basically wouldn't even fit a full size bed). It was supposed to be a double but it only had a extra wide twin bed in there. Also there wasn't much amenities (no TV), just a place to sleep and bathe. But then, in Rome, why would you want to spend time watching tv inside a hotel room?

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed and in need of sleep”
Reviews.Author: Singchick
Reviews.Content: The location in central, 3 blocks from the Spanish Steps, so for the spot it was definitely more budget-friendly than surrounding hotels. However, in this case, you get what you pay for...though much less. (108 eu a night) It is literally a room...4 walls and a bed. Not even a picture on the wall (which might have soaked up some of the noise...as I get to) We stayed in Room 20---if you ever decide to stay here, do not stay in room 20. It is the first door as you enter the small lobby...noisy from all the people going in and out, the people working at the place, and even just people in next door rooms on the phone (felt like they were holding a conversation right in front of you.) That does not compare to the noise from outside. Room 20 overlooks the street. Noisy restaurants, noisy street vendors, and traffic. And a special bonus, they are installing an elevator in the building, which they decide to start working on at about 7:15am. Between all of these things, I did not get any good nights sleep - or even a decent nap - during the 4 nights of my stay. Location good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Panda Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoggyBear
Reviews.Content: After much agonising on where to stay in Rome we went for Hotel Panda and we couldn't have asked for a better place. It is located within walking distance to all the major attractions and is very clean and friendly. We had a lovely room with an upstairs bathroom and a spacious sleeping area.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: cluckabell
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at the Hotel Panda or (Pensione Panda as its called there) in May 2007. We chose this hotel as we wanted something close to everything and was good value for money. We heard about the hotel in Lonely Planet guide where it got raving reviews & it didnt disapoint. Located in a stylish, upmarket area and a 2 min walk from the Spanish Steps, 5 mins from the main shopping highstreet and 10 min walk from Trevi fountain, its very basic but has everything you need. The beds werent the most comfortable but had no problem sleeping as your so knackered from walking around Rome all day! Rooms are spacious with lovely high painted ceilings. Directly outside the hotel on the street are a selection of fantastic cafe's and resturants which we used all the time!! The only downside with this place is having to leave!! Cant get anywhere better for such a central loctaion & so cheap! Ive recommended this to loads of mates, who have booked to go this year.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel With Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: nickpj
Reviews.Content: Pension Panda provides clean, basic accommodation at a reasonable price in a locale where most tourists are paying double or more for their rooms. We found that our quite large, clean room had a great view of the narrow Via Del Croce filled with restaurants, businesses and the passing crowd. Our ensuite bathroom was perfectly adequate although the "linen" bath towels took a little getting used to! Once we got our luggage into the room, we did not miss an elevator. The front desk people were very accommodating and very helpful to us giving advice and assisting with reservations Best of all, is the location within a few meters of the Spanish Steps. While we found we could walk almost everywhere we wanted to go, the nearby subway station whisked us cheaply and efficiently to further locales. No breakfast at the Panda, but the area is dotted with restaurants to suit all budgets as well as bakeries and stores selling various Italian delicacies.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Nicky-ps
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pensione Panda for 5 days and although our room was rather compact, it was extremely clean, quiet and comfortable and more than meet our needs. The location of this wee jem is fantastic. There are lots of restaurants and bars within walking distance, and the Spanish Steps and Metro are only minutes away. I'd definatly stay here again, and would recommend it to anyone on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “small, basic but central”
Reviews.Author: ziggystar
Reviews.Content: great location next to spanish steps and smack in the middle of designer shopping area. loads of restaurants close by. extremely cheap room rate for rome and location, friendly english speaking desk staff. rooms are very small as are showers but they are spotless. lots of stairs to climb too. security good with three sets of locks on the way up. if you are after a basic clean room in a brilliant location at a bargain price this is for you. rooms are very small though if thats not your thing. metro close by and easy to get to from the airport by bus/ metro

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: thegame_911
Reviews.Content: Hotel Panda is a great place to stay in Rome. It's located in the high end shopping district, near the Spanish steps. The room was small, but comfortable. The staff were really great and went out of their way to help us. They gave us directions, recommended restaurants, helped with our laundry and made reservations for the Borghese Gallery for us. The metro is really close, which makes it easy to get around. Also there's lots of interesting restaurants right out in front. And there's a supermarket really close by. We went there a lot to save food costs. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarcC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Panda for 6 nights in May of 2007. Best feature : Fantastic location - 50 Meters from the Spanish steps. Fair Price of Around 100 Euros a night. The hotel was 2 flights up a very dingy staircase but the rooms themselves were clean and recently updated with a fresh paint job. The en-suite bathroom had new fixtures and everything worked well. We faced a courtyard so the noise was not bad at all. The rooms are small but adequate and had a working Air Conditioner and telephone. Some points to consider: They have NO services to speak of. They don't have any place to lock up your valuables but there is only 1 entrance to the floor which is watched 24hr by the receptionist. There is no breakfast room but there are several cafes in the street where you can get breakfast less than 20 meters from the Hotel. You can pick up stuff at a small grocery store and a fruit and veg stand just around the corner. If you are taking a taxi to the Airport don't bother having them order you one. They charge around 8 Euros for the service and there is a Taxi stand at the bottom of the Spanish steps just up the street. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Panda Paradise/Pensione Panda in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ria6677
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel, which I have seen called Hotel Panda Paradise or Hotel Panda. However, the name outside the door refers to it as Pensione Panda. This is a very simple hotel, however it is very clean. They have air conditioning, but you have to pay for it (in 100 degree July weather, it's worth the 6 euros!). Our room had a double bed, a bench, a window, and a sink. The sink was the only feature that gave the room some character, with it's "Roman-style" tiles. We chose to have a shared bathroom. The bathrooms themselves are clean, however, they are very narrow. I am thin, and found myself squeezing past the sink and toilet to get to the shower. If you are obeise, I would not recommend this hotel; you would find the bathrooms unpleasant, to be sure. The hotel staff is nice, helpful, and speaks perfect English. We liked them quite a bit. When they could not answer our questions, they called around to find an answer. Very nice. The area the hotel is in is fabulous - a little over a block away from the Spanish Steps (and the espange metro stop) - we walked to the hotel from the metro stop. The surrounding area has lots of shops, restaurants, and bars. Lots to do and a clean, safe area. (touristy though). No elevator. No breakfast. Good value for the money, but don't expect anything fancy. Just clean, simple accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: Mary_Stuart
Reviews.Content: Location : perfect Spagna Metro station is at 2 minutes. You can walk to the Spanish Steps, the Pantheon... so accessible ! Located on a very pretty street with small cafés and restaurants, that crosses Via del Corso (for great shopping !) Price : perfect This is probably the cheapest hotel you can find with such an awesome location (78 euros with air cond.) The room and the bathroom were clean, personel friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hope you're traveling light!”
Reviews.Author: washall
Reviews.Content: First thing is first and that is that the Hotel Panda has a great location, very near the Spanish Steps. It is a small hotel, and I don't mean to indicate the number of rooms! There is no elevator, so if you are planning to travel with a lot of gear you will be miserable getting it up three flights of stairs, and through the small dark hallway and then figuring out what to do with your stuff once you squeeze in. That said, I was traveling with my husband and 2 children (ages 5 and 9) and we had quiet a bit of stuff with us after 2 weeks in Italy. The hotel, while small, is adequate enough when you are thinking that you just really need a place to shower, change clothes and rest your head at night. It is clean, and that counts for a lot. You must pay 6 euros for a remote control to use your air conditioner (and because of how small the rooms are, you really will want the circulation of air) We had an early flight, so I can't comment on what the included breakfast was like, but be on the lookout for the statue of Zeus (?) in the upper hall that has a freakishly out of proportion torso. It made me laugh everytime I walked under it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but staff not so hot.”
Reviews.Author: lmarkow
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel on the inside, mainly because of the vaulted ceilings and cleanliness. Furthermore it is near the center of everything and minutes away from the Spanish Steps. However, the staff was not helpful and a bit rude. Because of this I would probably look for another place in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: StingGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay in the Panda Hotel with my daughter. For us the location was excellent - right beside the Spanish Steps and in the best shopping area. You can walk easily to the Vatican, the Piazza Navona and the Trevi Fountain. The metro is a 2 minute walk away. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel is basic, clean and cheap - really all we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: gretman
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Room was small but very clean. I think all rooms in Rome are small anyway. You can not beat this price and this location in Rome. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Panda was perfect”
Reviews.Author: saraallison
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, another married couple and a friend took a trip to Rome at New Years, 2005. We chose to stay at the Panda for our first trip to Rome because of the location, price, and fact that they would let us all stay in the same room together to save money. This is a basic hotel but clean, safe, and quiet. The management was not overly friendly, but they were adequate. Our room was small by American standards, for 5 adults, but we knew it would be that way going into it. We had one small bathroom, but there was a shared bathroom right across the hall that we also made use of (it did not seem to be in high demand). This hotel is located right next to the Spanish Steps and a high-end shopping street, but we never had any noise problems at night, not even on New Year's Eve. There were some nice cafes on our street, and from here we walked everywhere (rarely used the subway b/c it was so packed). I recommend this place for anyone on a budget especially, but I would stay there again even if I wasn't!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: lisamWashington
Reviews.Content: Great location close to the Spanish steps. It was a bit hard to find at night. Situated down a quant coble stone street. Just what you would expect from being in Rome. Little restaurants line the streets and just about everything is within walking distance. The only drawback for my husband and I was that we had to share a bath. The room was small but it was a great deal and ideal location if you want to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Extreem Noise, no sleep, mistake in booking”
Reviews.Author: banditDublin
Reviews.Content: The rooms are the smallest I've ever come accross in any accomodation I've stayed in... and I've travelled a lot. We got the room right opposite the 'reception area', which opened around the 6-7 am time, extreeme noise occurs throughout the night in this area, staff have no calms about wearing high heels on a wooden floor right outside your room and continually walk up and down the halls all night, the 6-7am time was worse and it was not possible to get sleep beyhond this time even with wax ear-plugs. Although yes, it is very central and reasonably priced, if I had my time over I would have booked somewhere else for more money as our 3 days in Rome were ruined from extreeme lack of sleep. They also made a mistake with our booking which meant on our llast night to stay there our stuff was packed up for us and taken to reception, this was a mistake on their part not ours. I found the staff to be quite rude especially when we requested a room change from the one opposite reception, the other room was quieter but still a full night sleep couldn't be had.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful find”
Reviews.Author: pattylancastrian
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great trip to Rome. Wondeful city so easy to explore from our little pension, The Panda. Having read reviews already posted we weren't expecting 5 star luxury. As some people have already commented the rooms are small- (we had one with a bathroom though.) Although basic it was clean and we found the staff to be friendly and helpful. What makes this place special is the location, location, location. For the price the Panda is a real find and we would certainly stay there again. The little street where it is located has wonderful restaurants and wine bars. We particularly enjoyed the Ristorante Re Degli Amici which was right next door, The staff were really friendly and encouraged diners to speak to each other. This led to us meeting people from Canada, Denmark, USA and Ireland. As the wine flowed so did the conversation and we enjoyed it so much we ate there 4 times!!! My sister recently tried to book a stay here but it was full which is testament to its popularity. Get in there before its too late.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: lcmo1
Reviews.Content: As stated in many of these reviews, the location of the Hotel Panda can't be beat. Yes, the room we had (a double w shared bathroom) was tiny but we weren't in the room much. So it really didn't matter. The street was lively, crowded and very fun. A fruit market every morning on the cross street, and a super market down the street. FYI...it cost about 10 Euro from the train station. The cab driver who brought us to Hotel Panda from the Termini charged us double. Might help to know the real rate.

Reviews.Title: “A little noisy but very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: BayAreachick9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Holy Week last year, and we overall enjoyed our stay. The rooms are tiny (made me appreciate the spaciousness of New York City hotels!) but very clean and charming, with tile floors and wood beam ceilings. The closet was so close to the bed that you had to sit on the bed to open it, so we mostly kept our clothes in our suitcase. The location, however, is hard to beat, two small Roman blocks to the Spanish Steps, a five minute walk to some of the main sites--Pantheon, Vittorio Emmanuel, shopping. Spanish Steps area is really touristy (avoid the flower hawkers at the top who target couples) but generally this was a great location, and the area is supposed to be the English/American part of town. At night, the rooms were especially noisy; the walls are so thin I was awoken in the middle of the night by other guests walking through the hallway outside our door. But this is a budget hotel, after all, and the maid service was good and the shared bathrooms were pretty clean. I don't know if I'd stay here again (would rather stay closer to the Jewish Ghetto and Campo de Fiori) but wouldn't mind doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Long Time Fan!”
Reviews.Author: BellaErina
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Panda since 1999 or 2000. I lived in Rome and since moving back to Los Angeles, I know the city well. They have excellent and VERY kind people working there. You cannot beat the location. That is the best part! For tourists that come to Rome and stay near the Vatican, unfortunately, they have a very different experience. If you are coming to Rome..you should stay at the Panda. You cannot beat the price for the location. They treat me like family there. Champagne at Christmas....nice people. I think the only people that would not like the Panda are the "typical" americans I'm sorry to say. Those that don't know yet how Europe is- yes, the rooms are smaller. ..however, it's great. Walk out to Re degli Amici to eat- visit the wine bar (where people speak english!) - Antica Enoteca - walk to the Collisium, Foru Imperiale, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, "Rodeo Drive of Rome" SHOPPING. Via del corso..everything is right there. Even the metro! Guess I'm trying to say, save your money- the euro is high enough. The panda is great and the sheets are Oh So nice! If you go...tell PINO to give ANDA a raise ! : ) They make me very happy and treat me like family. I've stayed elsewhere...and lived in Roma. I definitely know what I'm talking about. Cheers o Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Be aware of no elevator”
Reviews.Author: givemesunshine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location around the corner from the Spanish steps. I stayed here with a 2 and 4 year-olds alone and when the taxi dropped us off in front of the hotel door I realized that the hotel is several flights upstairs. I had to carry the luggage and the two year old upstairs to find the hotel. There is no lobby, just a desk with a quiet guy sitting and typing on the computer. We had one of the bigger rooms and the room was fine for the three of us. When we left rome the receptionist arranged for a private car to take us for the airport. It cost less than a taxi and the driver helped me with my luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and cold place, though it has a good location”
Reviews.Author: WeeKee
Reviews.Content: We thought to check this place out after reading of the good review in a guidebook on the pensione. We arrived at the hotel late night and received a chilly reception. The guy was very cold towards us and didn't seem pleased to be serving us. He later warmed up a little but the impression remained. We asked to see the rooms and were shown two, a very tiny interior room without bathroom (for 68 Euro) and another with a bathroom (98 Euro). He insisted that the former is good for 2 people, though the single bed with single pillow in a tiny room tells us otherwise. We opted to pay more for a room with bathroom. While our room with bath is rather spacious, it is pretty dim even with all the lights on. The strong occupation due to good reviews on several guidebooks also meant higher prices in 2007, which we feel the hotel is pricing itself above its basic rooms without breakfast. We moved out the very next day morning after finding a pretty 3* hotel with breakfasts that costed us only 2 additional Euros per night, a mere few hundred metres away. While the location of Hotel Panda near the Spanish steps is fairly good, there are many better options not far away for very little more, especially during the low tourist season. With bad staff attitude, simple rooms and no breakfast, there are probably hotels in Rome that offer better value at the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great price, not so great shoebox, er hotel.”
Reviews.Author: segsmudge
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. we were in Rome for New Year's, and we were right in the middle of everything. it's a quick metro ride to Termini, near the Spanish steps, walkable to the Vatican and the Colosseum, and right in the middle of some great shopping and restaurants. But when i booked, i was told i was getting the last double room available, and they should have just told me it was a shoe box. It had a bathroom attached, sort of. You had to stand on the toilet to close the door, and the room was so small, that lying on the bed, my boyfriend could reach both walls with his palms! im fine with small rooms, but this one was slightly claustrophobic, and we ended up switching to a room that was a little larger. Except the new room was next to the stairwell and super loud. If you stay here, don't book room 26(shoe box), or 12(next to stairs). There is no carpet in the hallways, so they are really noisy when people have shoes on. If you stay here, make sure to bring earplugs and wear them every night. It was still great for the location and the price, but i would have rather been in a better room for a little more money. The front desk was helpful. They booked the Borghese gallery for us, but i had to stand there and wait for them to do it, to make sure it got done.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME location”
Reviews.Author: MELCOR
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine had told me about this little gem. We took her word and booked our first 3 nights in Rome at the Panda. It was great!!! The location is the best part, and the rate is MUCH less than any other places in that area. The rooms were very clean, the bathroom was spotless, and the staff speaks english. After our first night we tried to extend our stay, but unfortunatly they were fully booked. Also, the restaurant rigth next door was awesome. Our waiter was so friendly, and sweet. He brought our first shot of lemoncello on the house as a welcome to Italy. It was our first time to beautiful Italy, and if we ever get back to Rome I will definatley stay at the Panda again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Dougle23
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Panda for a long weekend in November and having read some reviews on here regarding lost bookings was slightly worried about going. However, once we arrived we checked in fine and had been allocated a room overlooking the street. It was basic but the bed was large and comfortable and it was clean. The best thing about this hotel is its location - it is a basic hotel but it is clean and you cannot beat where it is for the price. It is in the heart of Rome, the area was lovely, and everything is in walking distance from here. I would definately reccomend staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bolero200
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in oct. 2005. The location is truly excellent, smallish rooms, quiet. Front dek staff are extremely rude! Promised to call a taxi to go to the airport - and never did. We had to run to Piazza di Spagna and order one while we waited in vain for the one "ordered" by the hotel to arrive. Would stay there again only because of the location

Reviews.Title: “The best location fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: TrevandAl
Reviews.Content: I visted Rome with my mum this weekend for the first time (her 4th time) we found this excellent little pension as it was listed in many guide books. I kid you not it is a three minute walk to the bottom of the Spanish Steps and the Spagna Metro. It is also half a minute from the Corso - most famous shopping street, and Dior,Hermes, D&G, Roberto Cavali are all within seconds and open until 8pm which is fabulous following a busy days touring and before the numerous glasses of wine to accompany dinner. This hotel is basic, i got the impression that the staff are there merely to watch the door and so don't expect the concierge at Claridges but it was very clean and our room was fairly large with a king size bed and a single bed in it - perfect for the 6 hours we were there each night. Our bathroom was minute and if you had a large guy with you this could be a problem but for us it was no problem at all. We even had a little balcony that overlooked the court yard below, not very exciting but some outside space at least, and much better than the noise of the road facing rooms i guess. Be warned you need to be persistant to book this hotel - I had to call and email them 4 or 5 times and i think it just depends who you speak to, like i say many of the staff seem to be there just to watch the door. Without a doubt this Pension is fantastic due to the location. It is 3 metro stops from the main station which is nothing and a 3 day metro pass costs 11 euros. It is within a 10 minute walk of the Pantheon and Piazza Navona and not even 10 minutes from the Trevi Fountain. I reckon a straight and direct walk to the vatican would take 25 minutes top. but there is just so much to see and soak in - one of the things that was great about this hotel was that there are lots of restaurants and bars nearby so that you don;t have to worry about coming a long way home late at night. A few top tips i have are: go to St Peters about 3pm on a friday, there was no queue at all and we were the last people who were allowed to up the Basillica at 4.15 and they were very very strict about it. The final walk up the 350 steps to the very top is a killer but is totally worth it adn you eventually come back down in into St Peters, which also amazingly I timed right with 5pm mass and I was able to take communion in St Peter's which is a must for any Catholic. On Saturday I was lucky to have prebooked a tour of the Vatican museams and the Scistine Chapel before we went (cost about £30 each compared to 11 euros) but this was worth its weight in gold as when we arrived at 10am and spent 13 minutes walking past the two mile queue of people who were never going to get in and I was able to walk up to the guard and have my name ticked off a list! FANTASTIC!! we flew with Ryanair and i wasn't too sure about how to get from the airport to town but i had prebooked the terravision coach which i was a little sceptical about but for 14 euros return it worked like a dream. Don't forget to go to the Trevi at night as it is magical - and remember to throw your three cins in over your shoulder to ensure you return to this fantastic city! Finally, i really regret not taking my video camera (i had read on loads of sites that you couldn't video or take pics) i could have videoed everywhere apart from inside the sistine chapel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pupdud
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best values in Europe. We were in a great location for all of the attractions. The room was no frills, but the people at the desk spoke English and we always felt safe. The room did not have a TV, but most places in Europe did not have English stations anyway. The subway was also close to the hotel. There were many good restaurants outside the front door. The air cond. was an extra fee, but it was cool enought that we did not need it. We purchased the private driver from the airport through Panda. The drive was the fastest and most exciting ever. It was about thirty minutes of pure excitement with speeds of over 160 kmh in a Mercedes manual shift racer. Well worth the 47 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place - Recommend”
Reviews.Author: mimiworld
Reviews.Content: We just got back early this week and enjoyed our stay at the Panda Hotel. First time in Rome and used Trip Advisor to help find a place within our budget. We stayed in a room with a queen bed which didn't leave much space for anything else but if your in Rome to spend time in a hotel room this is definitely not the place for you. It was walking distance from everything and the street outside had flower vendors in the morning and several restaurants at night. We usually got something on the go from the small grocery store just a few steps from the entrance as it was a much cheaper breakfast. Being from the South we were surpirsed at the attitude of the employees. They were not what I woudl call personable but we got what we needed so can't really complain. I've been told this is what people in Rome are like. We had some friends staying in Rome at the same time and they choose a place near the Pantheon. We had dinner and heard about how loud it was for them. We on the other hand enjoyed very peacfull nights. While it's true that you couldn't hear anythign from the outside you could hear people coming down the hall at night. However, that didn't run too late and if it did then I slept though it. If you're like us we didn't go to Rome to see a hotel room. We were usually out the door no later than 8:30 am and back around 11pm at night so we could sleep and repeat the same the next day. I never asked and it might be worth mentioning that one night I took a shower and ran out of hot water within 5 minutes. The day before I took one and my husband right after with no problems - so they may turn it off or run out in the evenings I don't know which. Don't let the maps of Rome fool you, everything looks spread out, but it's not. We walked to the Collusieum, the Vatican and everywhere in between and this was a great spot for it all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: nicholasr
Reviews.Content: The location is Hotel Panda's main appeal. Don't expect luxury. Our room was very basic with a bed, limited wardrobe space,and no drawers. The only other piece of furniture was a small wooden bench which collapsed! The shower room was small and water temperature was hard to control. BUT friendly staff and spotlessly clean and the air-con was effective,even if it costs extra. Rome hotels are not noted for their value for money and Hotel Panda is not all that cheap (104 Euros per night Room only) but it has simple rustic charm, and its location is second to none. I'd consider staying there again

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: crystart
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location...safe, fun, quiet as it's just off the Spanish Steps. Was a small room, clean, nice clean small bathroom, and room had air conditionning (extra cost of 6E/day). The staff was nice enough but if you have troubles you may not like their attitude as I witnessed an argument with a customer who (for whatever the reasons were, somehting about the wrong types of beds) was refusing to pay for the remaining nights and wanted to leave while the front desk said "go ahead, we have your credit card information and we'll just charge you". Although we had no problems, the hotel's customer service could use some help but as we learned this is typical behaviour in Rome...not a friendly city. The only complaint we'd have is that the walls are think so we'd hear people come going up and down the halls. Other than being a bit noisy that way, all was good. Stayed early Sept 2006.

Reviews.Title: “Great option at the price”
Reviews.Author: helene2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel Panda 8-11 Sep (4 nights). Overall I would highly recommend this hotel. The location is fantastic, we did not need to use any public transport as all the main sights were within a 30 min walk (many, like the Spanish steps obviously, much nearer!) The area also has the advantage of feeling very safe, due to upmarket shops and the number of people around in the evenings. Via Del Croce (road on which the hotel is) and other neighouring streets are very lively, with lots of people sitting outside cafes etc. In terms of prices, clearly this is not best area for bargains, but our 2 chocolate croissants and 2 coffees in the street next to ours cost us under 7 dollars. The hotel itself is quite basic, ie no TVs in the rooms or communal areas. However our room had all it needed, everything was spotlessly clean. Also we had an ensuite double room and our was actually quite big, so much so that there was an extra single bed in there. Looking at photos posted by others it looks like room sizes are hugely variable, so may be worth requesting that room- can't remember number but it's the one right next to reception. I do agree that the shower cubicle is very small, so if you are significantly overweight or tall you will struggle. However the water pressure and hot water were great. We did not need to use the aircon as the room stayed cool despite it being hot during the day. As a final note I would advise bringing ear plugs - Via Del Croce is mostly pedestrian but due to all the people outside it gets noisy especially on Fri and Sat nights. However with ear plugs in this was fine and I would imagine it would be as least as bad in most other central streets of Rome as they would have more cars and scooters going down them. I did a LOT of research before booking this hotel so I know that it is more than fairly priced and I would definitely recommend it and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Teeny, tiny shower stall”
Reviews.Author: Pepepetrov
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience in Rome and we relied heavily on reviews on this and other websites. Most are accurate. The hotel is quite a climb to reception but our room was clean and comfortable. Shower was very tiny and if you are a person of any girth, find somewhere else because you'll never get into it. Honestly, the opening was no more that 18-20 inches and the entire stall is not more than 30 inches square. I'm short and average size and I had to step in sideways. We didn't need air conditioning because the weather was so nice but some smokers showed up in the room next to us and sat on the balcony puffing so we had to close the windows or have our whole room polluted. The room was very basic - no TV, no clocks, towels were what we refer to as tea towels and no hairdryer. The hotel overall felt safe and friendly and the location can't be beat. We would likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Option”
Reviews.Author: ashley627
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable budget hotel in the heart of Rome. The rooms are very small, but they are clean, and the staff is friendly. Also, the rooms are air-conditioned, which is an amazing blessing in the humid summer heat of Rome (and worth much more than the extra six euros they charge if you use it). Definitely consider this place if you're planning a trip to Rome; it is just down the street from the Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: AussieBill188
Reviews.Content: Completely lost my reservation even though it was booked in months in advance. Lied about room availability when I called before coming into the hotel resulting in losing over 70 euros in transport costs. The staff was rude and disorganised. Yes the place had a new coat of pant but it takes more than that to be professional! If you value enjoyment on your holiday, stay somewhere else in Rome. Don't risk staying here just to save a few euro.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Recommend”
Reviews.Author: BoundforItaly
Reviews.Content: My niece and I stayed at the Panda for 6 nights at the end of June, first part of July. The room, I believe #34, was better than I anticipated. There was one queen bed as well as a twin bed. Phone in room. Bath small (especially shower) but we still had room to string up our clothesline. Staff answered all our questions. It is a block from Spanish Steps. In the other direction, you have a main street, which you can walk to Victor Emmanuel Monument . The Colosseum and Roman Forum are very close to this monument as is the Capitoline Museum. Great price for this basic hotel with a great location. Be aware that there is no elevator ... have to climb 42 steps to get to reception level. Be sure to pay extra for air conditioning ... its well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “***** Location”
Reviews.Author: Seaforth35
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Panda for 3 nights as part of a 2 week tour of Italy and would recommend it. The room was basic but clean and large. The best bit about the hotel was definitely its location, it is ideal for exploring the city and there are some great restaurants and cafes on the street. Overall it is good value for money at only 98 euros for a double with private bathroom in the heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: jawsk
Reviews.Content: if you want a very basic clean place to stay then this is it. If you want something with airconditioning that works, or some other amenities that most americans take for granted, than it is worth paying a little more for a different hotel. But this place is in a great location, and if all you need is a place to sleep and shower, then this is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room but big location”
Reviews.Author: Pambo1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Italy and spent two nights at the Panda Hotel in Rome. I have never seen a room so tiny, the bed was 1.2 x 2.20m bed but there was a basin in the room. Even the window was narrow but long. As it was over 30 degrees we paid Euro 6 extra for the air conditioning which still made this hotel very inexpensive for the budget traveller who likes to be in the heart of the city. We paid E68 per night plus the E6 for air conditioning. Its is all about location. We were about 5 minutes walk to the Spanish Steps. There was a shared bathroom which was always vacant when we wanted to use it. The hotel was extremely clean and the staff and owners were really friendly. We paid E40 for a shuttle bus from the international airport to the doorstep of this quaint hotel which we considered to be a very good deal. Breakfast was not included however there were several small restaurants in the street, one which served breakfast at a very reasonable cost. We found this hotel in the Lonely Planet and it definitely lived up to the write-up. If it is location you are after then this is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “2* Hotel very clean, small rooms,central close to Spainish steps etc”
Reviews.Author: mww
Reviews.Content: Travelled 30 May - 2 June 2006. Hotel Panda is a great Hotel for those on budget. My family of five (children 16,14,12)booked two rooms (approx £420 for 3 nights ). Rooms very small but clean. Towels changed every day. NB Towels not your usual thick fluffy ones more like large white cotton sheets but served the purpose and did dry you! Ensuite facilities(shower , toilet, bidet and sink) small but adequate - everything very clean. NB not all rooms have en suite. Plenty of sockets for hair dryers etc. Air conditioning available but have to pay extra. We booked taxi to and from the airport via the Hotel - cost 65 eros each way for 5 of us. There is a airport bus near station costs slightly less per person. Hotel provides free maps and advice. Hotel excellent location - on quiet street. This Hotel doesn't provide breakfast but there are numerous cafes / restaurants nearby. Very central to main tourist sights- spainish steps 10 min walk, Trevei fountain 10 min. Colesseum, Forum , Pantheon etc all walking distance. Go and see 'unknown soldier ' buliding. Great eating out - not as expensive as I thoght it would be. Mant restaurants have set torist menus. Ice cream shops are fabulous - lots of choice. There are plenty of Macdonalds but we avoided these ! Be careful - Unfortunately we had our camera and video camera stolen on our third day from a modern restaurant near the Vatican. These people are very clever and know exactly what they are after! Shame they didn't leave our video tapes and memory stick behind -no use to them! Had great city break depite the unfortunate incident of theft.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent value, great room, spotless. The best location in Rome. All sights within walking distance. Will definitely return. Could not fault it.
